_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ent to conduct PSM audits every three years.  The elements of the PSM / Program 3 prevention program and a brief description are listed below.
	Employee Participation  Bridge Point Northlake has developed a site-specific employee participation plan that ensures employees and their representatives are consulted when conducting and developing process hazard analyses and other information required to be developed under the PSM/RMP regulation.  In addition, the employee participation program will ensure employees and their representatives have access to process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under PSM/RMP.  
	Process Safety Information  Bridge Point Northlake maintains a site-specific PSI program that ensures information pertaining to the hazards, technology, and equipment of the process are properly developed and maintained. 
	Process Hazard Analysis  Bridge Point Northlake has developed a site-specific PHA program that ensures a PHA is conducted initially, at a minimum of every five (5) years, and whenever a change is significant enough to require a change in PSI.  In addition, this program ensures PHAs are conducted in accordance with OSHA and EPA regulations and ensures findings and recommendations of PHAs are properly documented. Bridge Point Northlake completed a thorough PHA revalidation study for the ammonia refrigeration system on July 20, 2022.
	Operating Procedures  Bridge Point Northlake has updated a site-specific procedure that ensures operating procedures provide clear instruction for different phases of process operations and ensures they are properly maintained.  Bridge Point Northlake completed a thorough review and certification of operating procedures for the refrigeration system on December 17, 2021.
	Training  Bridge Point Northlake has developed a site-specific training procedure that ensures employees operating the ammonia process have the knowledge to safely operate the process, are aware of the pote

hlake has developed an Emergency Action Plan that contains procedures designed to maximize the safety of all employees, contractors, and visitors in the event of an emergency and also guard against environmental consequences. 

III.	Facility Identification
The Bridge Point Northlake facility is located at 555 Northwest Avenue in Northlake, Illinois. The NAICS code for the facility is 49312  Refrigerated Warehousing and Storage. 

The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. 

The amount of ammonia currently present in the refrigeration system is approximately 62,000 pounds.  The refrigeration system is used to cool the freezer system.

An aerial photo identifying the site location is included as Appendix A. 

IV.	Hazard Assessment  Worst Case Scenarios (WCS)
Appendix B consists of the RMP*Submit Printout and contains additional information on the worst-case scenario.  Appendix C consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the worst case release scenario. 

V.	Hazard Assessment  Alternative Release Scenarios (ARS)
Appendix B consists of the RMP*Submit Printout and contains additional information on the alternative release scenario.  Appendix D consists of the offsite consequence analysis data and maps for the alternative release scenario. 

 
VI.	General Accidental Release Prevention Program
A prevention program is in place to minimize the risk of hazardous chemical releases in accordance with the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119) and the EPA Risk Management Program.   However, as discussed throughout this document Bridge Point Northlake is continuously improving this program. 

This prevention program covers those processes that handle ammonia above the threshold quantity for both PSM and RMP rules. The most recent audit of the PSM program was conducted on January 10, 2020, and the next audit will occur before January 10, 2023, in compliance with the requirem

ntial hazards of the process, and understand the causes of process problems. However, refrigeration contractors are currently relied upon to operate and maintain the system.
 
	Management of Change  Bridge Point Northlake has developed a site-specific management of change procedure that ensures changes (except for replacement in kind) to the ammonia process, such as additions of new equipment or changes in operating, maintenance, or other procedures are documented. 
	Pre-Startup Review  Bridge Point Northlake has developed a site-specific pre-startup safety review procedure that ensures a safety review is performed when modifications to the ammonia process are significant enough to require a change in PSI.
	Mechanical Integrity  Bridge Point Northlake has updated a site-specific mechanical integrity procedure that ensures written preventative maintenance procedures are developed and maintained, preventative maintenance tests and inspections are properly documented, and employees maintaining the process receive adequate training.  
	Contractor Qualifications  Bridge Point Northlake has developed a site-specific contractor qualification procedure that ensures all contract employers safety performance and programs are evaluated, a contract employee injury and illness log is maintained, information of potential hazards are communicated between Bridge Point Northlake and the contract employer, and required training and information is communicated, such as the provisions of the emergency action plan and control over entrance into process areas.
	Incident Investigation  Bridge Point Northlake has developed a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  This procedure will also make provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the i

nvestigation and findings are promptly addressed. No ammonia releases have been reported within the past five (5) years.
	Compliance Audit  Bridge Point Northlake has developed a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that Bridge Point Northlake PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed.  The most recent compliance audit was completed January 10, 2020.    
	Hot Work Permits  Bridge Point Northlake has developed a best management practice for hot work.  
 

VII.	Five-Year Accident History
The Bridge Point Northlake facility has not had an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage in the last five years. 

VIII.	Emergency Response Program
Bridge Point Northlake has developed an emergency action plan to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release.  

Bridge Point Northlake has communicated and trained facility employees on proper evacuation procedures and has had interaction with the Northlake Fire Department.  

Bridge Point Northlake has coordinated their emergency action plan with the Cook County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the Northlake Fire Department.  This coordination effort includes providing each aforementioned agency with a copy of our Tier II report with a site diagram and hazardous material information.

Although Bridge Point Northlake does not have an onsite hazardous materials response team, contractors currently utilized for operation and maintenance of the refrigeration system have received HAZWOPER training through classroom instruction, on-the-job training, and drills.  The current HAZWOPER training in

cludes the first responder awareness level, the first responder operations level, and hazardous materials technician training.   

The facility has multiple windsocks present onsite for use in determining wind direction in the event of an ammonia release and evacuation of the building.

The current Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for anhydrous ammonia is included in Appendix E. 

IX.	Emergency Communications
The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are available onsite.
 

X.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Chemical safety is an important part of Bridge Point Northlake operations. Bridge Point Northlake recently conducted a process hazard analysis (PHA) of their ammonia refrigeration system and will be dutifully implementing the recommendations from that PHA. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for Bridge Point Northlake.  

XI.	Management Program
Bridge Point Northlake has developed a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.  This system has assigned qualified person(s) (or position) to assist in the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program elements.  If any portion of the program is delegated to others, the names or positions of those individuals will be documented and the lines of authority defined through an organization chart or similar document.  Currently, Scott Gilbert, Senior Property Manager of Bridge Industrial is responsible for implementation of the overall Risk Management Program.
